Pre-Game Insights: Tailing @RoyalsProps' Charlie Wright believes N. Powell will have a good game due to Utah's poor defense, especially from beyond the arc.
Powell's run of 10 straight games with 20+ points came to an end this week, but he is expected to bounce back in this matchup.
Kris Dunn's addition to the starting lineup gives the Clippers another ball handler who can get the rock to Powell, potentially boosting his volume.
Brian Condon believes J. Harden will have a good game, citing his past performances and potential opportunities in this matchup.
Top Shelf Action believes I. Zubac will have a good game, citing his past performances and potential opportunities in this matchup.
Royals Props believes J. Harden will have a good game, citing his past performances and potential opportunities in this matchup.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Utah has the 2nd-worst defensive rating and is allowing the 5th-most points per game, making them vulnerable to high-scoring teams like the Clippers.
Utah gets torched from beyond the arc, allowing the 4th-most made 3-pointers on the 5th-most attempts and the 5th-highest 3-point percentage.
The Clippers are 1-4 in their last 5 games, but they have a favorable matchup against Utah's struggling defense.
The Jazz are 9-26 overall, while the Clippers are 20-17, giving the Clippers a significant advantage in terms of record and momentum.
Others: The game is scheduled for 2:00 am on November 18, 2024, at the Intuit Dome in Inglewood.
The Jazz have several injuries, including Jordan Clarkson, John Collins, Keyonte George, Taylor Hendricks, and Brice Sensabaugh.
The Clippers also have an injury, with Kawhi Leonard out due to personal reasons.
